verses.verse: Canst thou draw <S%H4900>out<s%> <S%H3882>leviathan<s%> with a <S%H2443>fishhook<s%>? Or press down his <S%H3956>tongue<s%> with a <S%H2256>cord<s%>?
Canst thou <S%H7760>put<s%> a <S%H100>rope<s%> into his <S%H639>nose<s%>? Or <S%H5344>pierce<s%> his <S%H3895>jaw<s%> through with a <S%H2336>hook<s%>?
Will he make <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H8469>supplications<s%> unto <S%H1696>thee<s%>? Or will he speak soft words unto <S%H7390>thee<s%>?
Will he <S%H3772>make<s%> a <S%H1285>covenant<s%> with <S%H3947>thee<s%>, That thou shouldest take him for a <S%H5650>servant<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>?
Wilt thou <S%H7832>play<s%> with him as with a <S%H6833>bird<s%>? Or wilt thou <S%H7194>bind<s%> him for thy <S%H5291>maidens<s%>?
Will the <S%H2271>bands<s%> of fishermen make <S%H3739>traffic<s%> of <S%H2673>him<s%>? Will they part him among the <S%H3669>merchants<s%>?
Canst thou <S%H4390>fill<s%> his <S%H5785>skin<s%> with barbed <S%H7905>irons<s%>, Or his head with <S%H7218>fish<s%> - spears?
Lay <S%H7760><s%> thy <S%H3709>hand<s%> upon <S%H2142>him<s%>; Remember the <S%H4421>battle<s%>, and do so no <S%H3254>more<s%>.
Behold <S%H8431><s%>, the hope of him is in <S%H3576>vain<s%>: Will not one be cast <S%H2904>down<s%> even at the sight of <S%H4758>him<s%>?
None is so <S%H393>fierce<s%> that he dare stir him <S%H5782>up<s%>; Who then is he that can <S%H3320>stand<s%> before <S%H6440>me<s%>?
Who hath first <S%H6923>given<s%> unto <S%H7999>me<s%>, that I should repay <S%H8064>him<s%>? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
I will not keep silence <S%H2790>concerning<s%> his <S%H907>limbs<s%>, Nor his mighty <S%H1369>strength<s%>, nor his <S%H2433>goodly<s%> <S%H6187>frame<s%>.
Who can <S%H1540>strip<s%> off his <S%H6440>outer<s%> <S%H3830>garment<s%>? Who shall <S%H935>come<s%> <S%H3718>within<s%> his <S%H7448>jaws<s%>?
Who can <S%H6605>open<s%> the <S%H1817>doors<s%> of his <S%H6440>face<s%>? Round <S%H5439>about<s%> his <S%H8127>teeth<s%> is <S%H367>terror<s%>.
His strong <S%H4043>scales<s%> are his <S%H1346>pride<s%>, Shut up <S%H5462>together<s%> as with a <S%H6862>close<s%> <S%H2368>seal<s%>.
One <S%H259><s%> is so <S%H5066>near<s%> to <S%H259>another<s%>, That no <S%H7307>air<s%> can come between <S%H935>them<s%>.
They are <S%H1692>joined<s%> <S%H376>one<s%> to <S%H251>another<s%>; They stick <S%H3920>together<s%>, so that they cannot be <S%H6504>sundered<s%>.
His <S%H5846>sneezings<s%> <S%H1984>flash<s%> forth <S%H216>light<s%>, And his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are like the <S%H6079>eyelids<s%> of the <S%H7837>morning<s%>.
Out of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H1980>go<s%> burning <S%H3940>torches<s%>, And <S%H3590>sparks<s%> of <S%H784>fire<s%> leap <S%H4422>forth<s%>.
Out of his <S%H5156>nostrils<s%> a <S%H6227>smoke<s%> <S%H3318>goeth<s%>, As of a <S%H5301>boiling<s%> <S%H1731>pot<s%> and burning <S%H100>rushes<s%>.
His <S%H5315>breath<s%> <S%H3857>kindleth<s%> <S%H1513>coals<s%>, And a <S%H3851>flame<s%> goeth <S%H3318>forth<s%> from his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.
In his <S%H6677>neck<s%> <S%H3885>abideth<s%> <S%H5797>strength<s%>, And <S%H1670>terror<s%> <S%H1750>danceth<s%> before <S%H6440>him<s%>.
The <S%H4651>flakes<s%> of his <S%H1320>flesh<s%> are joined <S%H1692>together<s%>: They are <S%H3332>firm<s%> upon <S%H4131>him<s%>; They cannot be moved.
His <S%H3820>heart<s%> is as <S%H3332>firm<s%> as a <S%H68>stone<s%>; <S%H3332>Yea<s%>, firm as the <S%H8482>nether<s%> <S%H6400>millstone<s%>.
When he raiseth himself <S%H7613>up<s%>, the <S%H352>mighty<s%> are <S%H1481>afraid<s%>: By reason of <S%H7667>consternation<s%> they are beside <S%H2398>themselves<s%>.
If one <S%H5381>lay<s%> at him with the <S%H2719>sword<s%>, it cannot <S%H6965>avail<s%>; Nor the <S%H2595>spear<s%>, the <S%H4551>dart<s%>, nor the pointed <S%H8302>shaft<s%>.
He <S%H2803>counteth<s%> <S%H1270>iron<s%> as <S%H8401>straw<s%>, And <S%H5154>brass<s%> as <S%H7539>rotten<s%> <S%H6086>wood<s%>.
The <S%H1121>arrow<s%> cannot make him <S%H1272>flee<s%>: <S%H68>Sling-stones<s%> are <S%H2015>turned<s%> with him into <S%H7179>stubble<s%>.
Clubs <S%H8455><s%> are <S%H2803>counted<s%> as <S%H7179>stubble<s%>: He <S%H7832>laugheth<s%> at the <S%H7494>rushing<s%> of the <S%H3591>javelin<s%>.
His underparts are like <S%H2303>sharp<s%> <S%H2789>potsherds<s%>: He <S%H7502>spreadeth<s%> as it were a <S%H2742>threshing-wain<s%> upon the <S%H2916>mire<s%>.
He maketh the <S%H4688>deep<s%> to <S%H7570>boil<s%> like a <S%H5518>pot<s%>: He <S%H7760>maketh<s%> the <S%H3220>sea<s%> like a pot of <S%H4841>ointment<s%>.
He maketh a <S%H5410>path<s%> to <S%H215>shine<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> <S%H2803>him<s%>; One would think the <S%H8415>deep<s%> to be <S%H7872>hoary<s%>.
Upon <S%H6083>earth<s%> there is not his <S%H4915>like<s%>, That is <S%H6213>made<s%> <S%H1097>without<s%> <S%H2844>fear<s%>.
He <S%H7200>beholdeth<s%> everything that is <S%H1364>high<s%>: He is <S%H4428>king<s%> over all the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H7830>pride<s%>.
